cities.name: Andorra la Vella

interests.name: Casa de la Vall
interests.description: Historic 16th-century house that served as Andorra‚Äôs parliament for centuries, symbolizing the country‚Äôs unique political history.

interests.name: Barri Antic (Old Town)
interests.description: Charming old quarter with stone houses, narrow streets, small squares, and a quiet mountain-town atmosphere.

interests.name: Sant Esteve Church
interests.description: Romanesque church with later Baroque additions, located in the historic center near Casa de la Vall.

interests.name: Caldea Spa Complex
interests.description: Iconic glass spa building offering thermal baths, indoor and outdoor pools, and mountain views.

interests.name: Meritxell Avenue
interests.description: Main shopping street of Andorra la Vella, famous for duty-free shops and lively city energy.

cities.local_food_tip: Try traditional Andorran mountain dishes such as escudella (hearty stew), trinxat (potato and cabbage dish), cured meats, and local cheeses‚Äîperfect after a day in the mountains.

full_day.Morning: Start in the Barri Antic üèòÔ∏è, visit Casa de la Vall üèõÔ∏è, and step into Sant Esteve Church ‚õ™ for a calm introduction to the city.
full_day.Afternoon: Walk down Meritxell Avenue üõçÔ∏è for duty-free shopping and lunch, then relax at the Caldea Spa ‚ô®Ô∏è.
full_day.Sunset: Enjoy views from the river Valira area üåÑ as the mountains glow in evening light.
full_day.Night: Dinner in the old town üçΩÔ∏è followed by a quiet evening stroll through the illuminated center.

spring.description: Snow melts in the valleys, flowers bloom, and hiking trails reopen around the capital.

ideas.name: Light hiking near the city
ideas.description: Short trails with fresh alpine air.

summer.description: Cooler temperatures than surrounding regions make Andorra la Vella ideal for hiking and outdoor activities.

ideas.name: Open-air caf√©s

autumn.description: Forests turn gold and red, with crisp air and fewer visitors.

winter.description: Snowy mountains, festive atmosphere, and easy access to major ski resorts.

public_transport_tips.tip: Andorra has no trains; buses are the main form of public transport within the country.
Regular bus connections link Andorra la Vella with Barcelona and Toulouse.
The city center is compact and walkable.

cities.name: Escaldes-Engordany

interests.name: In√∫u Wellness Center

interests.name: Avinguda Carlemany

cities.local_food_tip: After spa time, try escudella (traditional mountain stew), trinxat (potato‚Äìcabbage dish), cured meats, and local cheeses‚Äîcomfort food that fits the alpine setting.

full_day.Morning: Begin with a relaxed walk along Avinguda Carlemany ‚òÄÔ∏è, stopping for coffee and light shopping. Visit the Carmen Thyssen Andorra Museum üé® for a cultural start.

full_day.Night: Dinner back in town üçΩÔ∏è followed by an evening stroll between Escaldes-Engordany and Andorra la Vella under city lights.

spring.description: Melting snow and fresh greenery make lakes and hillside paths accessible again.

autumn.description: Forests turn gold and red; fewer visitors and crisp light.

public_transport_tips.tip: Local buses connect Escaldes-Engordany with Andorra la Vella and surrounding parishes.

cities.name: La Massana & Canillo (Mountain Areas)

interests.name: Vallnord ‚Äì Pal Arinsal
interests.description: Major mountain and ski area above La Massana, popular year-round for skiing, hiking, biking, and panoramic views.

interests.name: Grandvalira ‚Äì Canillo Sector
interests.description: One of the largest ski areas in Europe, with Canillo as a key access point for winter sports and summer mountain activities.

interests.name: Sanctuary of Meritxell
interests.description: Modern basilica dedicated to Andorra‚Äôs patron saint, blending contemporary architecture with spiritual significance.

interests.name: Coma Pedrosa Natural Park
interests.description: Protected alpine park near La Massana, home to Andorra‚Äôs highest peak and scenic hiking trails.

interests.name: Tibetan Bridge of Canillo
interests.description: Suspension bridge high above a mountain valley, offering dramatic views and a light adventure experience.

cities.local_food_tip: Mountain restaurants serve hearty Andorran dishes like escudella, trinxat, grilled meats, and local cheeses‚Äîperfect after outdoor activities.

full_day.Morning: Start in La Massana ‚òÄÔ∏è and head up to Vallnord ‚Äì Pal Arinsal üèîÔ∏è for hiking trails or ski slopes depending on the season.
full_day.Afternoon: Drive toward Meritxell Sanctuary ‚õ™, then continue to Canillo for mountain walks or access to Grandvalira activities.
full_day.Sunset: Visit the Tibetan Bridge of Canillo üåÑ for dramatic valley views as the light fades.
full_day.Night: Dinner in a mountain village üçΩÔ∏è‚Äîquiet evenings, cool air, and starry skies.

spring.description: Snow melts at lower altitudes, opening scenic hiking routes and valleys.

summer.description: Cool alpine air, open lifts, and active mountain villages.

autumn.description: Golden forests, crisp air, and quieter trails.

winter.description: Snow-covered peaks, busy resorts, and classic alpine winter scenes.

public_transport_tips.tip: Regular buses connect La Massana and Canillo with Andorra la Vella.
Cable cars provide easy access to ski and hiking areas from both towns.
In winter, check weather and road conditions before mountain travel.
